In order to use SR-IOV on a compute node, the feature has
to be enabled and supported by the OS and the NICs.

The nova-compute service will report the SR-IOV VFs as

the binding:vnic_type direct.

The Hyper-V Mechanism Driver already supports ports with vnic_type direct,

Depends-On: Ied27bb4e1b36e743b33c6b65351c2ee942ef535e

Implements: blueprint networking-hyperv-sriov

commit_message:
Adds SR-IOV support

In order to use SR-IOV on a compute node, the feature has
to be enabled and supported by the OS and the NICs.

The nova-compute service will report the SR-IOV VFs as
PCI devices. SR-IOV is requested by creating a neutron port with
the binding:vnic_type direct.

The Hyper-V Mechanism Driver already supports ports with vnic_type direct,
so no changes are necessary to it.

An SR-IOV neutron port will contain the pci_slot in the port's profile.
When can use that information in order to determine whether SR-IOV has to
be enabled or not.

Depends-On: Ied27bb4e1b36e743b33c6b65351c2ee942ef535e

Implements: blueprint networking-hyperv-sriov

Change-Id: I131d65e45c59eec577bb8d076f674146e37de8e3

commit_message:
use format{v4,v6} options for Newton+

format option was removed in Pike but added in Newton - we need an
appropriate template for that while preserving Mitaka compatibility
https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/designate/pike.html#critical-issues

Change-Id: Ib5cb4bd79aba6ca37b21b8f0942bb09f9341d328
Closes-Bug: #1733079

subject: Add native Zuul v3 bindep fallback tests
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2018-01-04 19:40:10.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/bindep-fallback/run.yaml', 'zuul.d/projects.yaml', 'zuul.d/jobs.yaml'], 'message': 'Add native Zuul v3 bindep fallback tests

For project-config itself, use native Zuul v3 tests for testing that we
can install the bindep list for the used distributions.

Note that the new job does not run if the local bindep.txt file or
other-requirements.txt is changed since those files are irreleant for
this test. This test only tests jenkins/data/bindep-fallback.txt.

Since project-config is trusted, we cannot directly test that the jobs
work. Therefore add them as experimental - and then test that they work.
A followup change will then use these jobs by default.

Change-Id: Ia95b73aa955a07840ce9b66ba36a6da821e1d34c
'}]
commit_message:
Add native Zuul v3 bindep fallback tests

For project-config itself, use native Zuul v3 tests for testing that we
can install the bindep list for the used distributions.

Note that the new job does not run if the local bindep.txt file or
other-requirements.txt is changed since those files are irreleant for
this test. This test only tests jenkins/data/bindep-fallback.txt.

Since project-config is trusted, we cannot directly test that the jobs
work. Therefore add them as experimental - and then test that they work.
A followup change will then use these jobs by default.

Change-Id: Ia95b73aa955a07840ce9b66ba36a6da821e1d34c

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-03 20:53:18.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/api/v3/attachments.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/api/v3/test_attachments.py'], 'message': "Handle InvalidVolume when creating a volume attachment

If you try to attach a non-multiattach volume to more than
once instance using the 3.27 volume attachments API, the volume
API would return a 500 response because the volume is in-use.

This translates to a 500 in the compute API because nova isn't
expecting a random client exception.

Treat this like how os-reserve could fail in the same situation
and handle InvalidVolume which will be converted to an HTTPBadRequest
by ResourceExceptionHandler elsewhere in the WSGi stack.

Change-Id: I1a8068043159b034d700419675af87fc17e1faf5
Closes-Bug: #1741112
"}]
commit_message:
Handle InvalidVolume when creating a volume attachment

If you try to attach a non-multiattach volume to more than
once instance using the 3.27 volume attachments API, the volume
API would return a 500 response because the volume is in-use.

This translates to a 500 in the compute API because nova isn't
expecting a random client exception.

Treat this like how os-reserve could fail in the same situation
and handle InvalidVolume which will be converted to an HTTPBadRequest
by ResourceExceptionHandler elsewhere in the WSGi stack.

Change-Id: I1a8068043159b034d700419675af87fc17e1faf5
Closes-Bug: #1741112

commit_message:
Switch Glance-related tests (dashboards.project.images) to mock

Some duplicated test scenarios were deleted. This patch also doesn't
change Selenium tests because it's out of scope of unit tests.

This patch changes mox to mock for the following test module:
* openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/images/tests.py
* openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/images/images/tests.py
* openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/images/tests.py

Change-Id: I951c2e5ee1c133faa2106e1e1fdba5c72d6f63b7

commit_message:
Support use of json for relation data

In order to provide consistent presentation of relation data
in Python 3 based charms, support passing of data using JSON
format which ensures that data on relations won't continually
change due to non-deterministic dictionary iteration in py3.

Change-Id: I364a60ca7b91327fe88ee729cf49ff8ab3f5e2b6
Closes-Bug: 1741304

Right now, if a neutron port is owned by a container powered by
Kuryr, there is no way to list and filter those ports because
OSC assumed a neutron port is owned by either a server or router.
This patch adds support for that by introducing an option '--device-id'

Change-Id: Ib1fd27e8d843a99fb02ccabd8a12a24ac27cec9c

commit_message:
Allow ports filtering with device_id

Right now, if a neutron port is owned by a container powered by
Kuryr, there is no way to list and filter those ports because
OSC assumed a neutron port is owned by either a server or router.
This patch adds support for that by introducing an option '--device-id'
to the 'port list' command.

Change-Id: Ib1fd27e8d843a99fb02ccabd8a12a24ac27cec9c

subject: Apply (voluntarily) the maintenance-mode tag to the Trove project
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 782, 'name': 'John Garbutt', 'email': 'john.garbutt@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'johngarbutt'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 5263, 'name': 'Jeremy Stanley', 'display_name': 'fungi', 'email': 'fungi@yuggoth.org', 'username': 'fungi', 'status': 'missing, presumed fed'}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'display_name': 'flaper87', 'email': 'flavio.percoco@flyrlabs.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}, {'_account_id': 9664, 'name': 'amrith', 'email': 'amrith.kumar@gmail.com', 'username': 'amrith'}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 22818, 'name': 'Manoj Kumar', 'email': 'manoj@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'manojnkumar'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2017-09-20 08:42:21.000000000', 'files': ['reference/projects.yaml'], 'message': 'Apply (voluntarily) the maintenance-mode tag to the Trove project

This commit is a request to the TC to consider the application of the
maintenance-mode tag to the Trove project.

We are far enough along in the Pike release, and there is sufficient
confidence that the project team will be able to release a version of
Trove as part of the Pike release.

This request is that the maintenance-mode tag be applied to the
project for the reasons described below.

The 'maintenance-mode' tag is meant to signify that a project is in a
transient period of low activity. Here are some numbers that
illustrate this.

Release       LOC
---------------------
IceHouse      43,728
Juno          66,364
Kilo          45,825
Liberty       68,490
Mitaka        74,622
Newton        79,686
Ocata         53,513
Pike          31,150

The reasons for this are well known and I am not going to dwell upon
them here; they were the subject of discussion when the tag was
proposed [1], and when it was discussed by the TC.

When this tag was created, it had been the plan that it would
immediately be applied to the Trove project but after discussing this
with several people in the community, it was agreed that we would wait
a release cycle and see what if anything changed during that period of
time.

While the number of commits has decreased (about 50%), and the number
of lines of code changed in the release has decreased considerably
(about 40%) the project diversity has improved considerably[2].

The Pike release has seen strong contributions from AT&T, Ericsson and
EasyStack (my contributions were split between independent and Verizon
Wireless).

An email discussion on the ML to re-architect Trove[3] resulted in a
good discussion and there was strong support for keeping the current
project going, and there were several promises of participation and we
have some new contributors to the project team.

During the Pike cycle, the project team successfully met the
openstack-wide goal of having all control plane API's via WSGI[4] and
the goal to have voting unit tests for Python3[5,6].

There is good reason therefore, to believe that this phase is a
temporary one, and the project should be able to exit the
maintenance-mode by the end of the Queen cycle.

During the Queen cycle, the project will meet the requirements as
stipulated in[7] as we have been able to during the Pike release.

During the Queen cycle, every effort will be made to meet the cross
project deliverable goals.

At this time there is a commitment that resources will be available to
work on completing any remaining work required to support python3
(there are still some cases where this is not completely working).

There is a clear understanding that the goal to "register and document
policy in code"[8] is one that the project must work to deliver. Every
effort will be made to deliver this but at this time there is no
volunteer who has committed the resources to making this happen.

The goal to 'split tempest plugins into separate repos/projects'[9] is
of dubious value to Trove at this stage and there is currently no one
who has volunteered to do this work. A short lived attempt to remove
the tempest plugin[10] had to be reverted in a hurry[11].

Absent a volunteer to actually perform this work, and further commit
to maintain the independent test suite, it is unlikely that the Trove
project will meet this goal in the Queens cycle.

It is important to reiterate that this goal is one where real
completion is more than just splitting the plugins into another
repository. Admittedly one could meet the letter of the goal by just
spinning out a single test into a new repository and declaring
victory.  That approach, while sufficient to meet the community goal,
is clearly an exercise in futility as was the attempt to eliminate the
tests altogether. Without a contributor who is willing to commit time
to develop, maintain and augment the tests over at least a single
release cycle, it is basically a waste of time to attempt this goal.

For all of these reasons, this request is being made to apply the
status:maintenance-mode tag to the Trove project after a release
candidate for the Pike release has been made, and the tree split has
occurred and master is destined to Queens.

After consultation with the TC, and after demonstrating that the
project has exited the 'transient period of inactivity', and has an
active project team with an active and participating core review
team, a change will be proposed to remove the maintenance-mode tag
from the project.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/449925/
[2] http://stackalytics.com/?metric=commits&release=pike&module=trove-group
[3] http://openstack.markmail.org/thread/2s4gfpzukduazqts
[4] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/455477/
[5] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/454699/
[6] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/454697/
[7] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/tags/status_maintenance-mode.html#requirements
[8] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/queens/policy-in-code.html
[9] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/queens/split-tempest-plugins.html
[10] https://review.openstack.org/437020
[11] https://review.openstack.org/455430

Change-Id: I7fd30908454d9a01b15fd2d661a7b6165778279d
Depends-On: I9f9ec1ec49905e85d6671fba9b6f9893b289eff6
'}]
commit_message:
Apply (voluntarily) the maintenance-mode tag to the Trove project

This commit is a request to the TC to consider the application of the
maintenance-mode tag to the Trove project.

We are far enough along in the Pike release, and there is sufficient
confidence that the project team will be able to release a version of
Trove as part of the Pike release.

This request is that the maintenance-mode tag be applied to the
project for the reasons described below.

The 'maintenance-mode' tag is meant to signify that a project is in a
transient period of low activity. Here are some numbers that
illustrate this.

Release       LOC
---------------------
IceHouse      43,728
Juno          66,364
Kilo          45,825
Liberty       68,490
Mitaka        74,622
Newton        79,686
Ocata         53,513
Pike          31,150

The reasons for this are well known and I am not going to dwell upon
them here; they were the subject of discussion when the tag was
proposed [1], and when it was discussed by the TC.

When this tag was created, it had been the plan that it would
immediately be applied to the Trove project but after discussing this
with several people in the community, it was agreed that we would wait
a release cycle and see what if anything changed during that period of
time.

While the number of commits has decreased (about 50%), and the number
of lines of code changed in the release has decreased considerably
(about 40%) the project diversity has improved considerably[2].

The Pike release has seen strong contributions from AT&T, Ericsson and
EasyStack (my contributions were split between independent and Verizon
Wireless).

An email discussion on the ML to re-architect Trove[3] resulted in a
good discussion and there was strong support for keeping the current
project going, and there were several promises of participation and we
have some new contributors to the project team.

During the Pike cycle, the project team successfully met the
openstack-wide goal of having all control plane API's via WSGI[4] and
the goal to have voting unit tests for Python3[5,6].

There is good reason therefore, to believe that this phase is a
temporary one, and the project should be able to exit the
maintenance-mode by the end of the Queen cycle.

During the Queen cycle, the project will meet the requirements as
stipulated in[7] as we have been able to during the Pike release.

During the Queen cycle, every effort will be made to meet the cross
project deliverable goals.

At this time there is a commitment that resources will be available to
work on completing any remaining work required to support python3
(there are still some cases where this is not completely working).

There is a clear understanding that the goal to "register and document
policy in code"[8] is one that the project must work to deliver. Every
effort will be made to deliver this but at this time there is no
volunteer who has committed the resources to making this happen.

The goal to 'split tempest plugins into separate repos/projects'[9] is
of dubious value to Trove at this stage and there is currently no one
who has volunteered to do this work. A short lived attempt to remove
the tempest plugin[10] had to be reverted in a hurry[11].

Absent a volunteer to actually perform this work, and further commit
to maintain the independent test suite, it is unlikely that the Trove
project will meet this goal in the Queens cycle.

It is important to reiterate that this goal is one where real
completion is more than just splitting the plugins into another
repository. Admittedly one could meet the letter of the goal by just
spinning out a single test into a new repository and declaring
victory.  That approach, while sufficient to meet the community goal,
is clearly an exercise in futility as was the attempt to eliminate the
tests altogether. Without a contributor who is willing to commit time
to develop, maintain and augment the tests over at least a single
release cycle, it is basically a waste of time to attempt this goal.

For all of these reasons, this request is being made to apply the
status:maintenance-mode tag to the Trove project after a release
candidate for the Pike release has been made, and the tree split has
occurred and master is destined to Queens.

After consultation with the TC, and after demonstrating that the
project has exited the 'transient period of inactivity', and has an
active project team with an active and participating core review
team, a change will be proposed to remove the maintenance-mode tag
from the project.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/449925/
[2] http://stackalytics.com/?metric=commits&release=pike&module=trove-group
[3] http://openstack.markmail.org/thread/2s4gfpzukduazqts
[4] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/455477/
[5] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/454699/
[6] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/454697/
[7] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/tags/status_maintenance-mode.html#requirements
[8] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/queens/policy-in-code.html
[9] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/queens/split-tempest-plugins.html
[10] https://review.openstack.org/437020
[11] https://review.openstack.org/455430

Change-Id: I7fd30908454d9a01b15fd2d661a7b6165778279d
Depends-On: I9f9ec1ec49905e85d6671fba9b6f9893b289eff6

commit_message:
Rename option '--rm' to '--auto-remove'

I think the new option name '--auto-remove' is self-explanatory.
Also, the name style is more consistent with other options (prefer
full name to acronym).

Change-Id: I5def24aa8f31b23ce6e3eea75d355bca29a553f4

commit_message:
Update amulet tests for new s3/ec2/nova username

Keystone now orders the elements of the username when constructing
a username for multiple services. Update amulet to expect the
new username (only actually affects icehouse).

commit_message:
drop driver and topic settings in designate ctx

A similar change will land in designate to drop this extra topic as
well.

Also, driver and topic overrides in a service-specific context are not a
good idea.

Change-Id: I804a34fb044090010ecfd2560594cc1f55e9bd21
Closes-Bug: #1710831
Closes-Bug: #1738100
(cherry picked from commit b89de21d47dc9114d20456452cd867041bcd83c5)

subject: Minimize the effect overloaded Health Manager processes
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-01-04 01:31:23.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/controller/healthmanager/update_db.py', 'octavia/tests/unit/amphorae/drivers/health/test_heartbeat_udp.py', 'octavia/tests/unit/controller/healthmanager/test_update_db.py', 'octavia/amphorae/drivers/health/heartbeat_udp.py'], 'message': "Minimize the effect overloaded Health Manager processes

If a Health Manager is overloaded, it can begin to fall very far behind
in processing health updates. This causes huge delays in the whole
system and can cause two distinctly different issues:

1) If the HMs are all suddenly busy, delays can be long enough that no
messages get through within the failover timeout, and amps start to
fail, increasing load on the HMs and causing a cascade failure (I have
witnessed this happen once and take down over 50 LBs before manual
intervention could be taken)..

2) Even one overloaded HM can cause updates to queue for extremely long
periods, which makes the system unreliable. Amps can go down and still
have health updates register for some time as the HM processes the queue
(in some cases I have seen dead amps updated for 5-10 minutes).

If we short-circuit handling before we update the health table, we can
solve these problems in two ways:

1) The heavy processing generally happens after this, so
short-circuiting early will let some other threads finish faster and
have some chance of success.

2) Amphora health won't continue to be updated long after the messages
were received, so it won't be possible for zombie amphorae to eat as
many brains.

Change-Id: Iceeacfdcaebe1f9bb99bc08e318c9da73a66898d
"}]
commit_message:
Minimize the effect overloaded Health Manager processes

If a Health Manager is overloaded, it can begin to fall very far behind
in processing health updates. This causes huge delays in the whole
system and can cause two distinctly different issues:

1) If the HMs are all suddenly busy, delays can be long enough that no
messages get through within the failover timeout, and amps start to
fail, increasing load on the HMs and causing a cascade failure (I have
witnessed this happen once and take down over 50 LBs before manual
intervention could be taken)..

2) Even one overloaded HM can cause updates to queue for extremely long
periods, which makes the system unreliable. Amps can go down and still
have health updates register for some time as the HM processes the queue
(in some cases I have seen dead amps updated for 5-10 minutes).

If we short-circuit handling before we update the health table, we can
solve these problems in two ways:

1) The heavy processing generally happens after this, so
short-circuiting early will let some other threads finish faster and
have some chance of success.

2) Amphora health won't continue to be updated long after the messages
were received, so it won't be possible for zombie amphorae to eat as
many brains.

Change-Id: Iceeacfdcaebe1f9bb99bc08e318c9da73a66898d

commit_message:
Use keystone.common.provider_api for identity APIs

This change converts the usage of self.<provider_api> to
keystone.common.providers_api.ProviderAPIs.<provider_api> in manager
and controller logic. This is the correct way to reference
providers from other managers and controllers now that dependency
injection has been eliminated.

Change-Id: I4c9428f916fd28ee6df701aee26c5e2c516c4913

commit_message:
Use keystone.common.provider_api for catalog APIs

This change converts the usage of self.<provider_api> to
keystone.common.providers_api.ProviderAPIs.<provider_api> in manager
and controller logic. This is the correct way to reference
providers from other managers and controllers now that dependency
injection has been eliminated.

Change-Id: I86e3e360b01b3ce27414c13da3d94e22076ee93c

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-12-15 22:15:48.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/objects/base.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/objects/test_base.py', 'neutron/db/l3_db.py'], 'message': "FIP: update_floatingip_status() to return the updated object

Prior to this patch the update_floatingip_status() method didn't have a
return value. This patch changes that by returning the updated version
of the floating ip upon update success, just like any other update()
method.

This is important in certain situations because,
update_floatingip_status() bumps the ``revision_number`` of the FIP.
Drivers like networking-ovn (and potentially others) does track those
revision numbers updates as a way to ensure that the SDN database is up
to date with the Neutron database.

Change-Id: Ic261e91761ff8715c227f5213870d2db014355c8
"}]
commit_message:
FIP: update_floatingip_status() to return the updated object

Prior to this patch the update_floatingip_status() method didn't have a
return value. This patch changes that by returning the updated version
of the floating ip upon update success, just like any other update()
method.

This is important in certain situations because,
update_floatingip_status() bumps the ``revision_number`` of the FIP.
Drivers like networking-ovn (and potentially others) does track those
revision numbers updates as a way to ensure that the SDN database is up
to date with the Neutron database.

Change-Id: Ic261e91761ff8715c227f5213870d2db014355c8

The net-iso.yaml environment from tripleo-ci is uneeded as it's

commit_message:
Use ipv6 network templates from tripleo-heat-templates

Update quickstart ovb-ha (ipv6) jobs to use the network templates and
environments from tripleo-heat-templates instead of tripleo-ci. This
allows for having per-branch differences between the templates.

The net-iso.yaml environment from tripleo-ci is uneeded as it's
parameters are also set in network-environment.yaml, so it's usage is
removed.

Change-Id: I18b3bea25cd02682d3c58d665d234f7938e38856

commit_message:
Add a test case for populate_from_iterable()

There is no unit test of populate_from_iterable function for the
case that the parent is already in provider tree and update it at
the same time we add the child for that parent.

So this patch adds that test case.

Change-Id: If2bcefd74f51d0d0bc32eee54494dcaeea8bcbae

subject: Add attach/detach security group action to neutron driver
revisions:
[{'number': 23, 'created': '2018-01-04 21:55:22.000000000', 'files': ['congress_tempest_tests/tests/scenario/test_congress_basic_ops.py', 'congress/datasources/neutronv2_driver.py', 'congress_tempest_tests/tests/scenario/congress_datasources/test_neutronv2.py', 'congress/tests/datasources/test_neutronv2_driver.py', 'congress_tempest_tests/tests/scenario/manager_congress.py'], 'message': 'Add attach/detach security group action to neutron driver

To modify the security groups attached to the list through congress
policy, actions to attach/detach a security group to/from port is
needed.

Because the neutron v2 API and client do not support attach/detach
of a single security group, but only the replacement of the entire
security group list, we add these custom actions which combine
a read and update action to accomplish the attach/detach.

Caveat: Another concurrent update to the list of attached ports may
be lost. Unfortunately, there is simply no better solution given the
limitations of the neutron v2 API. So we enable these actions anyway
with documented warning in the driver actions description.

Change-Id: I51ec7452a5a7a77cc8cfc57b87e671685280ea73
'}]
commit_message:
Add attach/detach security group action to neutron driver

To modify the security groups attached to the list through congress
policy, actions to attach/detach a security group to/from port is
needed.

Because the neutron v2 API and client do not support attach/detach
of a single security group, but only the replacement of the entire
security group list, we add these custom actions which combine
a read and update action to accomplish the attach/detach.

Caveat: Another concurrent update to the list of attached ports may
be lost. Unfortunately, there is simply no better solution given the
limitations of the neutron v2 API. So we enable these actions anyway
with documented warning in the driver actions description.

Change-Id: I51ec7452a5a7a77cc8cfc57b87e671685280ea73

commit_message:
Add search_opts in func list of ManagerWithFind type classes

In patch I96339778fa69c379863078250d5dfa7172f2c1b2, it called
self.list with search_opts, but some subclasses of ManagerWithFind
do not have search_opts in function list, this make some list
functions and show by name functions fail and throw 'unexpected
keyword argument search_opts' error. This patch will fix it.

Change-Id: Ic4b65c0e5900a0e3e19155d5d9d42d5063c3137d
Closes-Bug: #1738917
Closes-Bug: #1738918

commit_message:
WIP: MairaDB: take ownership of entrypoint script

It has been observed that the MariaDB entrypoint script does
not always init the container in time, and also returns occasional
false +ves for having performed the init. See:
 * https://github.com/docker-library/mariadb/blob/master/docker-entrypoint.sh#L100-L106

Change-Id: I2b5aaa6a733d566536068b3bacad5a9f017f45e6

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-12-06 12:39:39.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/user/index.rst', 'castellan/common/credentials/keystone_token.py', 'castellan/common/utils.py', 'releasenotes/notes/deprecate-auth-endpoint-b91a3e67b5c7263f.yaml', 'castellan/tests/functional/key_manager/test_barbican_key_manager.py', 'castellan/key_manager/barbican_key_manager.py', 'castellan/common/credentials/keystone_password.py'], 'message': "Fix retrieving barbican endpoint from service catalog

The context wrapper classes under castellan.common.credentials were
missing an auth_url property resulting in calls to get_endpoint()
failing with 'Could not determine a suitable URL for the plugin' unless
users set barbican/auth_endpoint.

Change-Id: I1be3a1e11e3f4c2170062927ad359bf679eb25d9
Closes-Bug: #1497993
(cherry picked from commit 17e8b29067e93dbe5f13d0d18e62b06fcd148d3f)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix retrieving barbican endpoint from service catalog

The context wrapper classes under castellan.common.credentials were
missing an auth_url property resulting in calls to get_endpoint()
failing with 'Could not determine a suitable URL for the plugin' unless
users set barbican/auth_endpoint.

Change-Id: I1be3a1e11e3f4c2170062927ad359bf679eb25d9
Closes-Bug: #1497993
(cherry picked from commit 17e8b29067e93dbe5f13d0d18e62b06fcd148d3f)

This patch is saving the revision number from the Neutron network object
into OVNDB and using it for checking for correctness when updating the
OVN resource.

The "original_network" parameter has been removed from the
update_network() methods. Since the stragey here is to drop patches with
older revision numbers we won't be creating a delta between two neutron
versions anymore. Instead, we will always make sure that OVN is sync'd
with what is latest in Neutron.

Partial-Bug: #1605089
Change-Id: Ie817a559bd708f6601d7004187f0f088e8b09b47
'}]
commit_message:
Check for correctness when updating networks

This patch is saving the revision number from the Neutron network object
into OVNDB and using it for checking for correctness when updating the
OVN resource.

The "original_network" parameter has been removed from the
update_network() methods. Since the stragey here is to drop patches with
older revision numbers we won't be creating a delta between two neutron
versions anymore. Instead, we will always make sure that OVN is sync'd
with what is latest in Neutron.

Partial-Bug: #1605089
Change-Id: Ie817a559bd708f6601d7004187f0f088e8b09b47

subject: Fix exception when querying for non-existing items
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-01-03 10:19:31.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/tests/unit/network/drivers/neutron/test_base.py', 'octavia/network/drivers/neutron/base.py'], 'message': 'Fix exception when querying for non-existing items

An IndexError exception is raised when trying to get non-existing and
unique item resources via Neutron network driver.

Even though the exception is caught and raises a base.NetworkException
exception, it should raise an exception from
neutron_client_exceptions.NotFound instead.

Story: 2001424
Task: 6130

Change-Id: I0e99e846bb58b88d98598f2f2b52c7c1f8ea0967
'}]
commit_message:
Fix exception when querying for non-existing items

An IndexError exception is raised when trying to get non-existing and
unique item resources via Neutron network driver.

Even though the exception is caught and raises a base.NetworkException
exception, it should raise an exception from
neutron_client_exceptions.NotFound instead.

Story: 2001424
Task: 6130

Change-Id: I0e99e846bb58b88d98598f2f2b52c7c1f8ea0967

The error handling for duplicate records was not great, specifically
health monitors would return a 500 or a 409 with a bad error message.
This patch improves the errors the user gets back when creating a
duplicate entity.

Co-Authored-By: Jacky Hu <hudayou@hotmail.com>
Change-Id: I03ec527b42d67427541121e59e4433699e04aab8

commit_message:
Improve user error messages for duplicate objects

The error handling for duplicate records was not great, specifically
health monitors would return a 500 or a 409 with a bad error message.
This patch improves the errors the user gets back when creating a
duplicate entity.

Co-Authored-By: Jacky Hu <hudayou@hotmail.com>
Change-Id: I03ec527b42d67427541121e59e4433699e04aab8

subject: Handle InvalidScope exception from oslo.policy
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-01-04 17:30:02.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_policy.py', 'keystone/common/policy.py'], 'message': "Handle InvalidScope exception from oslo.policy

oslo.policy has the ability to check the scope of the request
against the scope of the operation and it will throw an InvalidScope
exception if they don't match. If we catch this exception, we should
throw a Forbidden instead because the caller doesn't have the
necessary role on the intended scope to perform the action.

Change-Id: I8805db48b2ce82397ce70cdb4d6b6d8178603339
"}]
commit_message:
Handle InvalidScope exception from oslo.policy

oslo.policy has the ability to check the scope of the request
against the scope of the operation and it will throw an InvalidScope
exception if they don't match. If we catch this exception, we should
throw a Forbidden instead because the caller doesn't have the
necessary role on the intended scope to perform the action.

Change-Id: I8805db48b2ce82397ce70cdb4d6b6d8178603339

commit_message:
Use keystone.common.provider_api directly in assignment

Convert use of self.<provider_api> to
keystone.common.provider_api.ProviderAPIs.<provider_api> for manager
calls. This is the correct way to reference managers now now that
the dependency injection has been eliminated.

Change-Id: I8e8431750486fc125e277c90557040c11c5802e9

commit_message:
Use keystone.common.provider_api for resource APIs

This change converts the usage of self.<provider_api> to
keystone.common.providers_api.ProviderAPIs.<provider_api> in manager
and controller logic. This is the correct way to reference
providers from other managers and controllers now that dependency
injection has been eliminated.

Change-Id: Id0305ce4e782dc8e8977dc7f802110148da2c901

commit_message:
Use keystone.common.provider_api for token APIs

This change converts the usage of self.<provider_api> to
keystone.common.providers_api.ProviderAPIs.<provider_api> in manager
and controller logic. This is the correct way to reference
providers from other managers and controllers now that dependency
injection has been eliminated.

Change-Id: I853dd2d1fec159316b3101750b87aae9368bac58

subject: Handle InvalidVolume when creating a volume attachment
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-04 23:48:10.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/api/v3/attachments.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/api/v3/test_attachments.py'], 'message': "Handle InvalidVolume when creating a volume attachment

If you try to attach a non-multiattach volume to more than
once instance using the 3.27 volume attachments API, the volume
API would return a 500 response because the volume is in-use.

This translates to a 500 in the compute API because nova isn't
expecting a random client exception.

Treat this like how os-reserve could fail in the same situation
and handle InvalidVolume which will be converted to an HTTPBadRequest
by ResourceExceptionHandler elsewhere in the WSGi stack.

Change-Id: I1a8068043159b034d700419675af87fc17e1faf5
Closes-Bug: #1741112
(cherry picked from commit 727e334950c672b9309ad6a1394488dbdc13952f)
"}]
commit_message:
Handle InvalidVolume when creating a volume attachment

If you try to attach a non-multiattach volume to more than
once instance using the 3.27 volume attachments API, the volume
API would return a 500 response because the volume is in-use.

This translates to a 500 in the compute API because nova isn't
expecting a random client exception.

Treat this like how os-reserve could fail in the same situation
and handle InvalidVolume which will be converted to an HTTPBadRequest
by ResourceExceptionHandler elsewhere in the WSGi stack.

Change-Id: I1a8068043159b034d700419675af87fc17e1faf5
Closes-Bug: #1741112
(cherry picked from commit 727e334950c672b9309ad6a1394488dbdc13952f)

subject: gnocchi/ceilometer upgrade workflow fix
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2813, 'name': 'Mehdi Abaakouk', 'email': 'sileht@sileht.net', 'username': 'sileht'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 6924, 'name': 'Pradeep Kilambi', 'email': 'pkilambi@redhat.com', 'username': 'pkilambi'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2017-12-18 17:39:22.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/base/ceilometer/collector.pp', 'manifests/profile/base/gnocchi/api.pp'], 'message': "gnocchi/ceilometer upgrade workflow fix

The current workflow for gnocchi/ceilometer upgrade doesn't
work well with swift backend.

Notification agent push data into Gnocchi on step4, but
Ceilometer-upgrade run only on step5, So Gnocchi have not been populated
with latest resource schemas.

Gnocchi-api is started in step3 but gnocchi::storage configuration have
not been done and database upgrade have not been done.

When configuration is done on step4, httpd will be restarted.

This change will fix this issue by:

* Doing only the Gnocchi database upgrade on step3 because swift is
  ready only on step4.
* Configuring gnocchi::storage on step3 to avoid gnocchi-api restart on
  step4.
* Move ceilometer-notification on step4 to ensure ceilometer-upgrade
  have been run.

This ensures:

* gnocchi-api will be correctly configured at the end of
  step3 (configuration+database-sync).
* No new measures will be pushed to Gnocchi before ceilometer-upgrade have
  upgraded the Gnocchi resource schemas.
* Gnocchi-api have database updated before ceilometer-upgrade need it.
* We continue to upgrade storage/incoming data of Gnocchi on step4 after
  swift is up.

Closes-bug: #1724328
Change-Id: I3f9a784e507e03454b335ba8319601fba208ba0a
(cherry picked from commit 4e6939c1a874a06f336321a9d44d9991872f74cf)
"}]
commit_message:
gnocchi/ceilometer upgrade workflow fix

The current workflow for gnocchi/ceilometer upgrade doesn't
work well with swift backend.

Notification agent push data into Gnocchi on step4, but
Ceilometer-upgrade run only on step5, So Gnocchi have not been populated
with latest resource schemas.

Gnocchi-api is started in step3 but gnocchi::storage configuration have
not been done and database upgrade have not been done.

When configuration is done on step4, httpd will be restarted.

This change will fix this issue by:

* Doing only the Gnocchi database upgrade on step3 because swift is
  ready only on step4.
* Configuring gnocchi::storage on step3 to avoid gnocchi-api restart on
  step4.
* Move ceilometer-notification on step4 to ensure ceilometer-upgrade
  have been run.

This ensures:

* gnocchi-api will be correctly configured at the end of
  step3 (configuration+database-sync).
* No new measures will be pushed to Gnocchi before ceilometer-upgrade have
  upgraded the Gnocchi resource schemas.
* Gnocchi-api have database updated before ceilometer-upgrade need it.
* We continue to upgrade storage/incoming data of Gnocchi on step4 after
  swift is up.

Closes-bug: #1724328
Change-Id: I3f9a784e507e03454b335ba8319601fba208ba0a
(cherry picked from commit 4e6939c1a874a06f336321a9d44d9991872f74cf)

commit_message:
Devstack integration for configuration file validation

This last part adds the agent to the devstack deployment, a
basic tempest test of the datasource and gives an example of
its use.

Implementation of a datasource that transcribes the content
of configuration files managed by oslo-config in Congress
tables.

The datasource uses a set of agents deployed on the nodes
to access the configuration files.

Change-Id: Ibda41c44e551e6dc8e5895968018c7169c34c9c8
Implements: blueprint configuration-files-validation
Co-Authored-By: Valentin Matton <vmatt.openstack@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Pierre Crégut <pierre.cregut@orange.com>

of configuration files managed by oslo-config in Congress
tables.

to access the configuration files.

Currently, there is not related UDP LB API. We intro a new LVS backend

commit_message:
Support UDP load balancing

Currently, there is not related UDP LB API. We intro a new LVS backend
which will work alongside the existing haproxy for UDP loadbalancing.

Change-Id: I1cd9fb55e171da1b9c1e703896917ec5b7c5d025
Story: 1657091

commit_message:
Add NIC Switchdev feature

Switchdev enables offloading rules from the datapath directly to
the NIC.
Libvirt support quering the NIC for Switchdev capability:
https://www.redhat.com/archives/libvir-list/2017-September/msg00482.html
More information regarding Switchdev can be found here:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/435954/11

Change-Id: I4220e795d744fbf76ce9f2deeceaa6ad3b9494ce

subject: Use default log levels overriding Sahara-specific only
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-04 17:57:55.000000000', 'files': ['sahara/config.py'], 'message': "Use default log levels overriding Sahara-specific only

Do not override all default logging values provided by oslo_log, but
only the levels required by Sahara.
The default values contain for example the defaults for 'amqp' and
'oslo.messaging', which were not covered (and fills quickly the logs).
Instead of manually synchronizing the default values (a process that
can be easily forgotten), just use whatever the defaults provide.

Closes-Bug: #1741233
Change-Id: I0ab6993e82f895e15d0367e3a404b3751fc3f36a
"}]
commit_message:
Use default log levels overriding Sahara-specific only

Do not override all default logging values provided by oslo_log, but
only the levels required by Sahara.
The default values contain for example the defaults for 'amqp' and
'oslo.messaging', which were not covered (and fills quickly the logs).
Instead of manually synchronizing the default values (a process that
can be easily forgotten), just use whatever the defaults provide.

Closes-Bug: #1741233
Change-Id: I0ab6993e82f895e15d0367e3a404b3751fc3f36a

commit_message:

* Add subnet to interface managed keys when updating nets matching
  interface port
* Add tests to verify that matching on "poor" nets with only
  subnet works.

Related-Bug: #1696483

commit_message:
Fix to prevent password from being displayed in logs.

During NetScaler driver login, password would be logged at info
level.  This changes the code to remove the password from the logged
message.

Change-Id: I8f5a19a9b51202a1c4bb9852ccdc3271ba479ea6
(cherry picked from commit b8018be8258f1bb1b46db95af4fd33f10eb42a4c)

Expose BDM uuid to drivers

commit_message:
DriverBlockDevice: make subclasses inherit _proxy_as_attr

This is a minor tidy-up in current code, as it allows volume_id and
volume_size to be inherited by all subclasses of
DriverVolumeBlockDevice. However, it's primary purpose it to make it
cleaner to add uuid to all DriverBlockDevice subclasses in a subsequent
patch.

Part of bp local-disk-serial-numbers

Change-Id: Ifabfaacf8752923493a78248593d2727a8ce4803

The nic-config templates used in tripleo-ci were never updated to use
"group: script" and were still using the deprecated "group:
os-apply-config".

This commit updates the templates. Doing so means they will also work
with the config-download deploy mechanism which only supports the
"group: script" method. This update allows us to move forward with

Change-Id: I23dcb9da36a609bcae57eabd7e072d094df5c884
'}]
commit_message:
Convert nic-config templates

The nic-config templates used in tripleo-ci were never updated to use
"group: script" and were still using the deprecated "group:
os-apply-config".

This commit updates the templates. Doing so means they will also work
with the config-download deploy mechanism which only supports the
"group: script" method. This update allows us to move forward with
converting ci jobs that use these templates (such as ovb-ha) to use
config-download.

Change-Id: I23dcb9da36a609bcae57eabd7e072d094df5c884

subject: Handle driver failures on create better.
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-10-30 23:59:30.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lbaas/services/loadbalancer/plugin.py'], 'message': 'Handle driver failures on create better.

Neutron-lbaas was leaving database objects behind on create calls if the
driver had a failure. This would lead to ghost objects in the database.
This patch fixes this such that if the driver raises an exception
the database object will be cleaned up.

Change-Id: I961280c6548bddc09c206130bdd8eb384fcad51b
'}]
commit_message:
Handle driver failures on create better.

Neutron-lbaas was leaving database objects behind on create calls if the
driver had a failure. This would lead to ghost objects in the database.
This patch fixes this such that if the driver raises an exception
the database object will be cleaned up.

Change-Id: I961280c6548bddc09c206130bdd8eb384fcad51b

subject: gnocchi/ceilometer upgrade workflow fix
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2813, 'name': 'Mehdi Abaakouk', 'email': 'sileht@sileht.net', 'username': 'sileht'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 6924, 'name': 'Pradeep Kilambi', 'email': 'pkilambi@redhat.com', 'username': 'pkilambi'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2017-12-18 10:59:43.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/base/ceilometer/upgrade.pp', 'manifests/profile/base/gnocchi/api.pp'], 'message': "gnocchi/ceilometer upgrade workflow fix

The current workflow for gnocchi/ceilometer upgrade doesn't
work well with swift backend.

Notification agent push data into Gnocchi on step4, but
Ceilometer-upgrade run only on step5, So Gnocchi have not been populated
with latest resource schemas.

Gnocchi-api is started in step3 but gnocchi::storage configuration have
not been done and database upgrade have not been done.

When configuration is done on step4, httpd will be restarted.

This change will fix this issue by:

* Doing only the Gnocchi database upgrade on step3 because swift is
  ready only on step4.
* Configuring gnocchi::storage on step3 to avoid gnocchi-api restart on
  step4.
* Add dependencies between ceilometer-upgrade and gnocchi-api in case of
  non multinode deployment.

This ensures:

* gnocchi-api will be correctly configured at the end of
  step3 (configuration+database-sync).
* No new measures will be pushed to Gnocchi before ceilometer-upgrade have
  upgraded the Gnocchi resource schemas.
* Gnocchi-api have database updated before ceilometer-upgrade need it.
* We continue to upgrade storage/incoming data of Gnocchi on step4 after
  swift is up.

Closes-bug: #1724328
Change-Id: I3f9a784e507e03454b335ba8319601fba208ba0a
"}]
commit_message:
gnocchi/ceilometer upgrade workflow fix

The current workflow for gnocchi/ceilometer upgrade doesn't
work well with swift backend.

Notification agent push data into Gnocchi on step4, but
Ceilometer-upgrade run only on step5, So Gnocchi have not been populated
with latest resource schemas.

Gnocchi-api is started in step3 but gnocchi::storage configuration have
not been done and database upgrade have not been done.

When configuration is done on step4, httpd will be restarted.

This change will fix this issue by:

* Doing only the Gnocchi database upgrade on step3 because swift is
  ready only on step4.
* Configuring gnocchi::storage on step3 to avoid gnocchi-api restart on
  step4.
* Add dependencies between ceilometer-upgrade and gnocchi-api in case of
  non multinode deployment.

This ensures:

* gnocchi-api will be correctly configured at the end of
  step3 (configuration+database-sync).
* No new measures will be pushed to Gnocchi before ceilometer-upgrade have
  upgraded the Gnocchi resource schemas.
* Gnocchi-api have database updated before ceilometer-upgrade need it.
* We continue to upgrade storage/incoming data of Gnocchi on step4 after
  swift is up.

Closes-bug: #1724328
Change-Id: I3f9a784e507e03454b335ba8319601fba208ba0a

commit_message:
Add support for getting volume details with a specified microversion

This allows us to get volume details and pass through a microversion.
This will be used to get a volume with microversion 3.48 where
the shared_targets and service_uuid parameters are in the response.
We will then use that information to determine if we should lock
attach/detach operations on that volume.

Part of blueprint multi-attach-volume

Change-Id: Ief30adfef35eefe03e5a3d3d9623cd48e4d334a4

commit_message:
Revert "Disable OVH"

This reverts commit 7bb2572c942af52b3c3b927ae898f04c088b4a04.

OVH has reenabled the CI account which runs our mirrors which means
nodepool can boot instances in this cloud again.

subject: Use default log levels overriding Sahara-specific only
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-04 11:51:52.000000000', 'files': ['sahara/config.py'], 'message': "Use default log levels overriding Sahara-specific only

Do not override all default logging values provided by oslo_log, but
only the levels required by Sahara.
The default values contain for example the defaults for 'amqp' and
'oslo.messaging', which were not covered (and fills quickly the logs).
Instead of manually synchronizing the default values (a process that
can be easily forgotten), just use whatever the defaults provide.

Closes-Bug: #1741233
Change-Id: I0ab6993e82f895e15d0367e3a404b3751fc3f36a
"}]
commit_message:
Use default log levels overriding Sahara-specific only

Do not override all default logging values provided by oslo_log, but
only the levels required by Sahara.
The default values contain for example the defaults for 'amqp' and
'oslo.messaging', which were not covered (and fills quickly the logs).
Instead of manually synchronizing the default values (a process that
can be easily forgotten), just use whatever the defaults provide.

Closes-Bug: #1741233
Change-Id: I0ab6993e82f895e15d0367e3a404b3751fc3f36a

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-12-28 02:27:36.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_shelve.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': 'Revert "Modify _poll_shelved_instances periodic task call _shelve_offload_instance()"

The periodic task will get an admin context, the admin context will generate a
random request id.
https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/oslo.context/tree/oslo_context/context.py#n263

And the DB method `action_event_start` will search previous action when it can't
find an action match that random request id.
https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py#n5783

So this periodic task can execute correctly the admin context get a random requset
id, and the action event will attach to the previous 'shelve' action.

This reverts commit 35729ef50ccf5580d8661876d1bbe9b4fa94ffa8.

Change-Id: Ib330918e64c31cbb7de3829d3f220da812f2da2f
partial-implements: blueprint fill-the-gap-for-instance-action-records
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Modify _poll_shelved_instances periodic task call _shelve_offload_instance()"

The periodic task will get an admin context, the admin context will generate a
random request id.
https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/oslo.context/tree/oslo_context/context.py#n263

And the DB method `action_event_start` will search previous action when it can't
find an action match that random request id.
https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py#n5783

So this periodic task can execute correctly the admin context get a random requset
id, and the action event will attach to the previous 'shelve' action.

This reverts commit 35729ef50ccf5580d8661876d1bbe9b4fa94ffa8.

Change-Id: Ib330918e64c31cbb7de3829d3f220da812f2da2f
partial-implements: blueprint fill-the-gap-for-instance-action-records

commit_message:
Add removal_policies_mode to ResourceGroup

This enables choice over the current behavior which is to always append
to the resource data blacklist, or overwrite it (which is sometimes needed
e.g if you decide you want to reuse that group index)

The default behavior is unchanged, but the new behavior can be selected
via the "update" value.

Change-Id: I1157627b07d98dd079657c320ad783a3ba5bce81
Closes-Bug: #1741053

subject: Downgrade WARNING-level log
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-11-03 14:30:30.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/stack.py'], 'message': "Downgrade WARNING-level log

It's expected that when a resource completes and the traversal it was
processing is no longer active, we won't update the stack state in the
database. Therefore don't log at WARNING level for this routine event.

Change-Id: Ic901e46c251400c4eeb90a4d9ad4a97d61fb1af8
"}]
commit_message:
Downgrade WARNING-level log

It's expected that when a resource completes and the traversal it was
processing is no longer active, we won't update the stack state in the
database. Therefore don't log at WARNING level for this routine event.

Change-Id: Ic901e46c251400c4eeb90a4d9ad4a97d61fb1af8

subject: Don't try resource-level locks when stack locked
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-11-03 14:30:30.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resource.py'], 'message': "Don't try resource-level locks when stack locked

The actions SUSPEND, RESUME, SNAPSHOT, CHECK, and also DELETE when
abandoning rather than deleting a stack, have not (yet) been converted
to the convergence workflow and still do a legacy-style in-memory
traversal with the Stack lock held, even on stacks with convergence
enabled. Since a7376f7494b310e9367ebe5dcb43b432a4053023 we have been
attempting to get a lock on the Resource to do these operations, even
though there is no engine ID set (which caused a WARNING-level log). For
these operations, respect existing Resource locks when convergence is
enabled, but don't try to acquire the lock.

Change-Id: I6f232380398a7caf9664717debfe39e3422e70d8
Related-Bug: #1727142
Related-Bug: #1662585
"}]
commit_message:
Don't try resource-level locks when stack locked

The actions SUSPEND, RESUME, SNAPSHOT, CHECK, and also DELETE when
abandoning rather than deleting a stack, have not (yet) been converted
to the convergence workflow and still do a legacy-style in-memory
traversal with the Stack lock held, even on stacks with convergence
enabled. Since a7376f7494b310e9367ebe5dcb43b432a4053023 we have been
attempting to get a lock on the Resource to do these operations, even
though there is no engine ID set (which caused a WARNING-level log). For
these operations, respect existing Resource locks when convergence is
enabled, but don't try to acquire the lock.

Change-Id: I6f232380398a7caf9664717debfe39e3422e70d8
Related-Bug: #1727142
Related-Bug: #1662585

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-12-19 06:38:49.000000000', 'files': ['.zuul.yaml', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Remove run-tests and py3-run-tests

We have standard jobs for doing unittests under python2 and python3 -
namely, the builtin tox environments py27 and py35. Just use those and
remove the locally defined jobs.

Depends-On: I6d7a96adf5cfb075f5a2ffbd089ccbb883a1c1b4
Change-Id: I0cc0c07daafba331a64861c134029e443ba2aa8d

commit_message:
Remove run-tests and py3-run-tests

We have standard jobs for doing unittests under python2 and python3 -
namely, the builtin tox environments py27 and py35. Just use those and
remove the locally defined jobs.

Depends-On: I6d7a96adf5cfb075f5a2ffbd089ccbb883a1c1b4
Change-Id: I0cc0c07daafba331a64861c134029e443ba2aa8d

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-01-03 23:40:23.000000000', 'files': ['roles/overcloud-deploy/templates/overcloud-deploy-post.sh.j2', 'roles/overcloud-deploy/README.md'], 'message': "overcloud-post: introduce gnocchi_quick_policy

Adding gnocchi_quick_policy parameter (false by default).
When set to true, 2 commands will be run after having the overcloud
deployed:

gnocchi archive-policy create quick -d  granularity:15s,timespan:1day
gnocchi archive-policy-rule create -a quick -m cpu_util quick-rule

For now, we'll configure this policy in TripleO Quickstart, as we expect
the user to choose what's best for the deployment.
The boolean will be set to true on scenario001 so we can decrease the
runtime of the CI job.

Change-Id: I16825eacebb828059cea612089dbd1efe5d8e557
"}]
commit_message:
overcloud-post: introduce gnocchi_quick_policy

Adding gnocchi_quick_policy parameter (false by default).
When set to true, 2 commands will be run after having the overcloud
deployed:

gnocchi archive-policy create quick -d  granularity:15s,timespan:1day
gnocchi archive-policy-rule create -a quick -m cpu_util quick-rule

For now, we'll configure this policy in TripleO Quickstart, as we expect
the user to choose what's best for the deployment.
The boolean will be set to true on scenario001 so we can decrease the
runtime of the CI job.

Change-Id: I16825eacebb828059cea612089dbd1efe5d8e557

commit_message:
Add neutron-vpnaas docs and release notes pub job to zuul layout

One of the requirements[1] for Neutron stadium projects is to have
in-tree developer documentation. This creates a stub for that. We can
expand on it once the stub is in, but this will permit us to set up
publishing while we iterate on it.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/latest/contributor/stadium/governance.html#checklist

Change-Id: I55d016994fc41d61c415722872b58ed3823259ee

subject: add version fallback env var when no git upstream
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-12-05 20:27:33.000000000', 'files': ['pbr/packaging.py', 'doc/source/user/packagers.rst'], 'message': 'add version fallback env var when no git upstream

setting the environment variable

    PBR_<PACKAGENAME>_FALLBACK_VERSION

allows user to tell PBR the version of a package
even when the git version calculation fail.

Example in the following use case:
- project with some python dependencies in
  git submodules located in a «\xa0deps\xa0»
  directory at the root of a project using PBR
- project installs dependencies using
    pip install -e ./deps/mydependency
- project is built in a Dockerfile in gitlab ci
  and so, the CI handles the git project +
  submodule check out, and does not provide
  access to upstream git during the docker build.
- in it, PBR complains about missing
  «\xa0upstream git repository\xa0».

In the previous example, with this patch,
one only has to define

    PBR_ MYDEPENDENCY_FALLBACK_VERSION

to have PBR versioning calculation using
git history to fail and take this version string.

Change-Id: Ide9a5f4165ef194802a6c14d5ccf76f31cd54222
Signed-off-by: Gaetan Semet <gaetan@xeberon.net>
'}]
commit_message:
add version fallback env var when no git upstream

setting the environment variable

    PBR_<PACKAGENAME>_FALLBACK_VERSION

allows user to tell PBR the version of a package
even when the git version calculation fail.

Example in the following use case:
- project with some python dependencies in
  git submodules located in a « deps »
  directory at the root of a project using PBR
- project installs dependencies using
    pip install -e ./deps/mydependency
- project is built in a Dockerfile in gitlab ci
  and so, the CI handles the git project +
  submodule check out, and does not provide
  access to upstream git during the docker build.
- in it, PBR complains about missing
  « upstream git repository ».

In the previous example, with this patch,
one only has to define

    PBR_ MYDEPENDENCY_FALLBACK_VERSION

to have PBR versioning calculation using
git history to fail and take this version string.

Change-Id: Ide9a5f4165ef194802a6c14d5ccf76f31cd54222
Signed-off-by: Gaetan Semet <gaetan@xeberon.net>

subject: Wait for found shard ranges to be replicated before cleaving
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-03 11:17:34.000000000', 'files': ['test/probe/test_sharder.py', 'swift/container/sharder.py'], 'message': "Wait for found shard ranges to be replicated before cleaving

After finding new scan ranges on the leader node we weren't waiting
for the leader's db to be replicated before proceeding to cleave.
Worse, we weren't setting Scan-Done=True until *after* spawning the
replication job. It seems that things worked out because the
replication thread typically ran after Scan-Done had been set. In
fact, the probe test meta_timestamp assertions only passed because the
replication of the leader db occurred after cleaving had completed, so
all replicas got the leader's cleaved meta_timestamps.

This change sets Scan-Done before replicating and adds a wait so that
we know the leader's found shard ranges and Scan-Done state have been
replicated before proceeding with the sharding state machine. That
makes it easier to reason about the state of each node.

Change-Id: I5b75189cf1b2a9f04bcd44893d5d212a6524481a
"}]
commit_message:
Wait for found shard ranges to be replicated before cleaving

After finding new scan ranges on the leader node we weren't waiting
for the leader's db to be replicated before proceeding to cleave.
Worse, we weren't setting Scan-Done=True until *after* spawning the
replication job. It seems that things worked out because the
replication thread typically ran after Scan-Done had been set. In
fact, the probe test meta_timestamp assertions only passed because the
replication of the leader db occurred after cleaving had completed, so
all replicas got the leader's cleaved meta_timestamps.

This change sets Scan-Done before replicating and adds a wait so that
we know the leader's found shard ranges and Scan-Done state have been
replicated before proceeding with the sharding state machine. That
makes it easier to reason about the state of each node.

Change-Id: I5b75189cf1b2a9f04bcd44893d5d212a6524481a

subject: Fix differing bootstrap uuids
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-04 00:13:56.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/percona_hooks.py', 'hooks/percona_utils.py'], 'message': 'Fix differing bootstrap uuids

When is_bootstrapped is consulted it was returning a false negative.
When the leader node is bootstrapped it sets the uuid via leader_set,
but during a leader-settings-changed hook when the non-leader should
be picking up the uuid it was checking relation data instead which will
be way behind the curve. This is a vestigial block of code
pre-leadership.

Leader settings get set much earlier than relation data. This change
consults leader_get rather than the relation. We also make sure the
mysqld.cnf file is rendered on a leader-settings-changed hook.

Change-Id: I95e56bd28152c934f413025a22dd6821b2ad8e94
Closes-Bug: #1738896
'}]
commit_message:
Fix differing bootstrap uuids

When is_bootstrapped is consulted it was returning a false negative.
When the leader node is bootstrapped it sets the uuid via leader_set,
but during a leader-settings-changed hook when the non-leader should
be picking up the uuid it was checking relation data instead which will
be way behind the curve. This is a vestigial block of code
pre-leadership.

Leader settings get set much earlier than relation data. This change
consults leader_get rather than the relation. We also make sure the
mysqld.cnf file is rendered on a leader-settings-changed hook.

Change-Id: I95e56bd28152c934f413025a22dd6821b2ad8e94
Closes-Bug: #1738896

commit_message:
Re-factor and improve update_networks_matching_iface_port

* Implement _find_best_match() using subset intersection.
* Reduce number of expensive external neutron calls to get net_id by
  moving this outside the inner loop.

Unit test updated, we now do a better job at matching and populate more
data when updating.

Partial-Bug: #1696483
Partial-Bug: #1702279
Change-Id: I2157d35e1c58f3960d5b6aa86199d93bb5b88401

subject: Remove periods at the end of validator and converter messages
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-01-03 05:40:35.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lib/tests/unit/api/validators/test_validators.py', 'neutron_lib/api/validators/__init__.py', 'neutron_lib/api/converters.py'], 'message': 'Remove periods at the end of validator and converter messages

Messages fixed in this commit are wrapped at the end of other messages,
where the outer messages themselves have periods at the end. Thus the
extra periods of these messages should be removed to avoid duplication
in user facing messages.

An example for reference:

$ openstack firewall group rule create --source-port BEEF --protocol tcp
Invalid input for source_port. Reason: Invalid port: BEEF..

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I76bfed5a91cb569119e1e83ee3bf3917bb526e79
'}]
commit_message:
Remove periods at the end of validator and converter messages

Messages fixed in this commit are wrapped at the end of other messages,
where the outer messages themselves have periods at the end. Thus the
extra periods of these messages should be removed to avoid duplication
in user facing messages.

An example for reference:

$ openstack firewall group rule create --source-port BEEF --protocol tcp
Invalid input for source_port. Reason: Invalid port: BEEF..

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I76bfed5a91cb569119e1e83ee3bf3917bb526e79

commit_message:
Make sure we only run tempest-full on master

Since tempest-full is part of the integrated gate, it is executed
against all stable branches. However since stable branches will
not get roles from master anymore this does not work.

We may want to backport all devstack ansbile changes, but in the
meanwhile this ensures that a working job is executed against
stable branches.

Change-Id: I5d34e5b983b720dc1913d00ccc1a16d81a040d49
Partial-bug: #1739829

commit_message:
fix the tempest failure for external ceph

show_multiple_locations is missing for external ceph, and it will
cause tempest run failed.
it means the conditon for show_multiple_locations is
glance_backend_ceph but not enable_ceph, this patch it fix it.

Change-Id: I3c95c3b0a7e34639b376bdfd0205f3930b06e2cd
Closes-Bug: #1741022
Co-Authored-By: chenqiaomin <chen.qiaomin@99cloud.net>

subject: Fix failure handling in prechecks
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-12-14 14:06:00.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/prechecks/tasks/service_checks.yml', 'ansible/roles/haproxy/tasks/precheck.yml'], 'message': "Fix failure handling in prechecks

In a HAProxy precheck task, the command module is used, and the results
inspected by checking the stdout attribute of the result. However, if
the command fails (non-zero exit code), in some cases there may not be a
stdout attribute in the result object. This causes an AttributeError and
prevents ansible's useful diagnostic output from being displayed.

Change-Id: Id502b5d0b71fe2150a29df43154c925dca96ef06
Trivial Fix
"}]
commit_message:
Fix failure handling in prechecks

In a HAProxy precheck task, the command module is used, and the results
inspected by checking the stdout attribute of the result. However, if
the command fails (non-zero exit code), in some cases there may not be a
stdout attribute in the result object. This causes an AttributeError and
prevents ansible's useful diagnostic output from being displayed.

Change-Id: Id502b5d0b71fe2150a29df43154c925dca96ef06
Trivial Fix

commit_message:
Add tempurl to swift pipeline

This is required for some tempest tests and in turn to achieve 100%
refstack certification for clouds deployed by Kolla. tempurl is default in
Swift[0] but we're missing as we override the pipeline.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/\
    b86bf15a644db4438770801a312fe074a09c91ef/\
    etc/proxy-server.conf-sample#L97

Change-Id: I0e36fcd7a785f878005d51159eb51725c284229c

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I84cee5a9a728b9d6dc7909ac28a60b9c20c2348c

subject: Fix incorrect volume type value in ng images create volume form
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-03 21:55:27.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/images/steps/create-volume/create-volume.controller.js', 'openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/images/steps/create-volume/create-volume.controller.spec.js'], 'message': "Fix incorrect volume type value in ng images create volume form

The value of the 'volume_type' is determined by the 'volumeType'
object [1]. The value of the 'volume_type' changes only the
'volumeType' object changes. However, the current value of the
'volume_type' is changed according to the volume object change [2].

It will cause a phenomenon, when the page is initialized, the value
of 'volume_type' is empty, when we switch volume types drop-down box,
its value is also empty, only change the name, description, size and
availability zone, the value of 'volume_type' is the page selection.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/images/steps/create-volume/create-volume.html#L45
[2] https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/images/steps/create-volume/create-volume.controller.js#L140

Change-Id: If754d0c2ced844414c35829d4cefa1fb861522d5
Closes-Bug:#1737900
(cherry picked from commit 3aee4cbac666f080133671790baa9dd42223c996)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix incorrect volume type value in ng images create volume form

The value of the 'volume_type' is determined by the 'volumeType'
object [1]. The value of the 'volume_type' changes only the
'volumeType' object changes. However, the current value of the
'volume_type' is changed according to the volume object change [2].

It will cause a phenomenon, when the page is initialized, the value
of 'volume_type' is empty, when we switch volume types drop-down box,
its value is also empty, only change the name, description, size and
availability zone, the value of 'volume_type' is the page selection.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/images/steps/create-volume/create-volume.html#L45
[2] https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/images/steps/create-volume/create-volume.controller.js#L140

Change-Id: If754d0c2ced844414c35829d4cefa1fb861522d5
Closes-Bug:#1737900
(cherry picked from commit 3aee4cbac666f080133671790baa9dd42223c996)

deleted BDMs. This change adds a test which asserts the online
migration correctly assigns a uuid to soft deleted BDMs.

Part of bp local-disk-serial-numbers

Change-Id: Icf7dd4e3ecf0257d59f82cea80f76f12495594db
'}]
commit_message:
Add test for assignment of uuid to a deleted BDM

We eventually want to make the BDM uuid column not nullable. This
will require that there are no null values in the column, including in
deleted BDMs. This change adds a test which asserts the online
migration correctly assigns a uuid to soft deleted BDMs.

Part of bp local-disk-serial-numbers

Change-Id: Icf7dd4e3ecf0257d59f82cea80f76f12495594db

commit_message:
Update monasca driver to use keystoneauth1

Use of keystone client removed and replaced with
new standard method of using keystoneauth1 in
datasource_utils.

Updated the way service endpoint is retrieved from
keystone, using keystone session rather than
keystone client.

Also cleaned up the confusing overloading of self.creds
for poll_time and other unrelated uses.

Change-Id: I6cd1daa3de0d7483c2f17e30a6b80ae41907444b

commit_message:
monasca-ui: add drilldown subpackage

monasca-ui comes with a scripted Grafana dashboard for Grafana
2.x and higher that can be used for alarm drilldown links.
This commit adds the grafana-monasca-drilldown subpackage that
installs this scripted dashboard into Grafana's dashboard
directory.

subject: Don't overwrite device_id of existing port
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-01-03 05:40:35.000000000', 'files': ['kuryr_libnetwork/tests/unit/port_driver/drivers/test_vlan.py', 'kuryr_libnetwork/tests/unit/port_driver/drivers/test_veth.py', 'kuryr_libnetwork/port_driver/driver.py'], 'message': "Don't overwrite device_id of existing port

Right now, we use libnetwork endpoint ID as the device_id of
neutron port. However, if the neutron port is pre-created by users,
users might want to customize the value of device_id. A use case is
to set the device_id as the ID of the container so that users can
list ports belonging to a specific container.

This patch proposes to perserve the device_id of existing neutron
ports if the device_id is not empty.

Change-Id: I9cdfdb0b0db6bf9ab0983144a0d7f0dc5ecbd05f
"}]
commit_message:
Don't overwrite device_id of existing port

Right now, we use libnetwork endpoint ID as the device_id of
neutron port. However, if the neutron port is pre-created by users,
users might want to customize the value of device_id. A use case is
to set the device_id as the ID of the container so that users can
list ports belonging to a specific container.

This patch proposes to perserve the device_id of existing neutron
ports if the device_id is not empty.

Change-Id: I9cdfdb0b0db6bf9ab0983144a0d7f0dc5ecbd05f

commit_message:
Do not use -y for package install

According to "code conventions" [1], do not use "-y" option.
Instead, use apt-get install package, yum install package,
or zypper install package.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/doc-contrib-guide/writing-style/code-conventions.html

Change-Id: I65dc0ee8e5d9c5558098c32866bab3d372fd095a

commit_message:

size is to be increased as a result cluster-resize), the newly created

subject: Only copy openafs centos rpms if we built them
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-03 21:19:41.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/package-afs-centos/post.yaml'], 'message': "Only copy openafs centos rpms if we built them

The openafs centos packaging job only builds new rpms if the desired
version doesn't have an rpm published. Otherwise it short circuits and
the job ends. Unfortunately the post tasks assume the rpm will always be
built so this job then fails. Fix this by checking for rpms before
running the post tasks.

Change-Id: I132b82d437a19f855a49d175a912792417a85ae9
"}]
commit_message:
Only copy openafs centos rpms if we built them

The openafs centos packaging job only builds new rpms if the desired
version doesn't have an rpm published. Otherwise it short circuits and
the job ends. Unfortunately the post tasks assume the rpm will always be
built so this job then fails. Fix this by checking for rpms before
running the post tasks.

Change-Id: I132b82d437a19f855a49d175a912792417a85ae9

These are not recommended for use in OpenStack anymore and both nose and
testr offer native setuptools commands that can be manually aliased to

removal in the future.

Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Deprecate testr and nose integration

These are not recommended for use in OpenStack anymore and both nose and
testr offer native setuptools commands that can be manually aliased to
'test' on a per-project basis if necessary. Deprecate with an eye to
removal in the future.

Change-Id: I753f2ffe8b223b180b8ed813d879b3a28b47a1ab
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Optimize inconsistency detection (Part 1)

Create the database model and migration scripts for saving the revision
number of the OVN objects in the Neutron database.

Update the methods related to the network resource to use the new table.

Next patches in the series will use this new table to detect when the
resource is out of sync and fix it.

Related-Bug: #1605089
Change-Id: Id14e9e8b88797acec11b72117c6985c49ea713c9

commit_message:
Make the allowed_address_pairs driver better

The allowed address pairs network driver did not handle having objects
already deleted properly and would prematurely fail.
This patch improves the edge case handling of the driver.

Change-Id: Ice15aa2d6309648da43d6a40ce0286d5dce17500
Story: 2001258
Task: 5791
(cherry picked from commit ab0fe776d854fdf7970eb96efb32ac1a8a9e26a5)

subject: Truncate error_summary if exc_info not explicitly passed
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-01-03 21:14:49.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_log/formatters.py', 'oslo_log/tests/unit/test_log.py'], 'message': 'Truncate error_summary if exc_info not explicitly passed

Currently, when logging at level >= WARNING, exception information is
added to the log message as an "error summary" for operators. The error
summary includes the exception type and the message. However, when the
exception is a _Remote exception generated from oslo.messaging and sent
over RPC, the full traceback from the exception is appended to the
exception message [1] to preserve it. So, the error summary ends up
outputting the full traceback, unintentionally.

This truncates the error_summary to keep only the first line unless
exc_info was explicitly passed, via LOG.exception(), for example.

Closes-Bug: #1729475

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.messaging/blob/8d42484/oslo_messaging/_drivers/common.py#L208

Change-Id: I2e4e356d23dff2e6ac1946fe9e994c4d962ab55a
'}]
commit_message:
Truncate error_summary if exc_info not explicitly passed

Currently, when logging at level >= WARNING, exception information is
added to the log message as an "error summary" for operators. The error
summary includes the exception type and the message. However, when the
exception is a _Remote exception generated from oslo.messaging and sent
over RPC, the full traceback from the exception is appended to the
exception message [1] to preserve it. So, the error summary ends up
outputting the full traceback, unintentionally.

This truncates the error_summary to keep only the first line unless
exc_info was explicitly passed, via LOG.exception(), for example.

Closes-Bug: #1729475

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.messaging/blob/8d42484/oslo_messaging/_drivers/common.py#L208

commit_message:
Deprecate API extensions policies

Nova API extension concept is removed in Pike. These extensions
have their own policies enforcement which are not needed any more.

All the below policies which were added mainly for extensions are
deprecated for removal-
        - 'os_compute_api:os-config-drive'
        - 'os_compute_api:os-extended-availability-zone'
        - 'os_compute_api:os-extended-status'
        - 'os_compute_api:os-extended-volumes'
        - 'os_compute_api:os-keypairs'
        - 'os_compute_api:os-server-usage'
        - 'os_compute_api:os-security-groups' (only from /servers APIs)
        - 'os_compute_api:os-flavor-rxtx'
        - 'os_compute_api:os-flavor-access' (only from /flavors APIs)
        - 'os_compute_api:image-size'

Implement blueprint api-extensions-policy-removal

Depends-On: I6aed4909b0e7efe9c95d1f7398db613eca05e5ce

Change-Id: Ie05f4e84519f8a00ffb66ea5ee920d5c7722a66b

commit_message:
Allow using custom enum values for API fields

Some vendor drivers support things we don't expose directly, like UDP
protocol loadbalancing. This would allow us to query the handler to
determine feature support during API operations.

We move validation to the controller for specific fields (probably there
will need to be more fields implemented using this pattern) and allow
each provider to override the list of "supported" values for each field.

This patch also finally splits up POOL and LISTENER protocol constants,
as they should really be distinct lists.

Change-Id: I41c414474e2e56fb6500e9686a8f4ab72ac32cda
